I have always said we must set our priorities based on our values.

Fighting for the rights of coal miners is engrained in my family history and we have always understood that miners deserve better benefits, better health care and a better quality of life. #PromiseKept
On Christmas Eve 1927, the company came and threw my family out in the cold because my grandfather was trying to improve the quality of life for all coal miners. #PromiseKept

My grandfather came to this wonderful country from Italy in 1900 and started working in the coal mines at the age of 9. 
 
In 1927, he had a wife and 5 kids. He couldn‚Äôt pay his bills because he wasn‚Äôt paid in money but in company scrip. #PromiseKept pic.twitter.com/Y4xXI3Wk0X

On Dec. 11, I put a hold on all Senate legislation until I got assurances that a permanent fix would be delivered this year.

And this week, we finally secured a permanent fix in the spending deal, ensuring retired coal miners won‚Äôt lose their healthcare or pensions #PromiseKept

In November, I was proud to partner with a bipartisan group of my colleagues, including @senatemajldr, to introduce the Bipartisan American Miners Act that would secure pensions for 92,000 coal miners and their families and healthcare for 13,000 coal miners. #PromiseKept

Things came to a head in October of this year. 
 
Murray Energy declared bankruptcy, significantly moving up the deadline for pensions. 
 
Instead of going insolvent in 2022, the UMWA pension fund would now go insolvent in 2020. #PromiseKept
I turned around and immediately introduced the American Miners Pension Act with Senator Capito and Congressman McKinley and Congressman Welch to secure pensions for 92,000 coal miners. #PromiseKept

In typical fashion, Congress waited until the very last minute. But on May 1, we secured a permanent healthcare fix for 22,600 retired coal miners. 
 
Although this was a huge win, we still needed to fulfill our whole obligation and secure miners pensions. #PromiseKept

In January 2017 I received assurances from then President-Elect Donald Trump that he was committed to finding a fix. But by March, 22,600 coal miners received letters telling them their healthcare would be terminated by the end of April. #PromiseKept

In December 2016, I threatened to shutdown the government until I was assured not one coal miner would lose their healthcare. Mitch McConnell would agree to nothing other than a four-month extension on healthcare. #PromiseKept
That‚Äôs why I wrote the Miners Protection Act and introduced it with my fellow Senator from West Virginia @SenCapito and Senators @SenBobCasey and @SenSherrodBrown #PromiseKept

In 2015, we knew the United Mine Workers of American 1974 Pension Plan was severely underfunded.

If the Plan became insolvent, these coal miners would have had their pensions cut and the government PBGC would have assumed billions of dollars in liabilities. #PromiseKept

Coal miners are the most patriotic people in America. 

They have done the heavy lifting. They have done everything that has been asked of them by this country. 
 
They provided the energy that made us the greatest country on earth - the superpower of the world. #PromiseKept

And I want to give my sincere thanks to all of my colleagues for putting partisan politics aside and for rising above the divisiveness and tribalism in order to keep the promise we made in 1946. #PromiseKept

On Monday, after four long years of working hard through many uncertainties, Congress came together, Democrats and Republicans, to secure healthcare and pensions for our nation‚Äôs coal miners. #PromiseKept
